text.headline: Business Process Improvement Manager, Solar Product Group, North America
text.text:
ABB, Phoenix, AZ

  • Created, received global approval for, and led a pilot project utilizing Microsoft Power BI as a self-service decision making system. Successfully merged 8 departmental functions into a single automated dashboard.
  • Automated the integration of SalesForce, Oracle, SAP, and other enterprise data sources for near-real-time reporting, including alerts and predictive / prescriptive analytics for business leaders.
  • Proactively developed training materials and trained 50+ co-workers on Power BI, PowerQuery, and PowerPivot.
  • Provided analytical support to 10+ developers who designed and built real-time apps which monitor production, workforce allocation, supplier compliance, inventory, financial services, sales, legal, service, and quality.
  • SharePoint administrator and technical developer for 23 corporate SharePoint sites.
  • Laid off (with severance package) when ABB made the decision to close its Phoenix manufacturing facility.

text.headline: Customer Quality Engineer Manager / Global Renewable Energy Data Analyst
text.text:
ABB (formerly POWER-ONE), Phoenix, AZ

  • Created a warranty accrual model using information from all pertinent data sources to accurately predict 10+ years of field failures for over 2 million shipped products based upon historical failure rates. The model was a major contributor to the Power-One acquisition by ABB ($1B) with ≈1% variance from actual field failure rates. The accrual model also passed 3 external audits from both Deloitte and Ernst & Young with high praises.
  • Direct company interface for all customer quality issues. Led weekly meetings with senior quality leadership at 4 top-tier customers. Wrote and submitted over 100 customer Root Cause / Corrective Action reports.
  • Global Project Lead for the Early Warning System (EWS), a BI tool using over 60TB of mixed data to identify key problems in real time to resolve issues and provide automated customer, product, and regional analysis.
  • Created stored procedures to automate ETL, data quality, and performance tuning from multiple sources (Oracle, SalesForce, MySQL, factory test equipment…), which automatically populated quality reports (failure trends and pareto analysis) and distributed reporting via email and web-based dashboards to global teams.
  • Developed an enterprise-class, real-time solar site monitoring solution using MongoDB, MySQL and Excel spark charts to visually track 186, 1.5MW inverters daily power production curves and track any faults. The customer preferred using this tool vs. the software thay paid more than $10M for. Compressed data set was more than 40Gb.

text.headline: Quality Information Systems Manager / Quality Engineer
text.text:
POWER-ONE, Phoenix, AZ

  • Used TSQL coding and relational database design tools to create data warehouses using 3 MySQL instances.
  • Used Pentaho Data-Integration for automated ETL jobs, data quality analysis, and to export multiple reports providing near-real-time access to metrics which previously required 80+ man hours per month to compile.
  • Designed and developed 5 global dashboards for quality monitoring and gap analysis. Empowered multiple departments to identify problem areas, create viable solutions, and monitor reliability.
  • Quality project manager for global projects in the development and implementation of the Agile PLM Product Quality Module as the company’s global Quality Management System and Best Practices tool. ($600K+ budget)
  • Responsible for Global Quality department SharePoint Administration. Created themes, workflows, lists, pages, and processes. Managed all permissions and created training materials for the global team of more than 60 quality professionals.

text.headline: President
text.text:
MATTANG LLC.

Developed Mattang from an idea my brother and I shared into a full retail clothing business. We had a Board of Directors consisting of leaders located throughout the Polynesian nation including: Maori chieftains, a Grammy-award-winning musician, Royal Hawaiians, professional surfers, tribal artists, and record-holding professional strongmen.

While building Mattang, we created our designs and began manufacturing our clothing line in South Korea. Unfortunately, the manufacturer went bankrupt and we lost our entire investment.

text.headline: Administration Officer
text.text:
FLEET ACTIVITIES CHINHAE, Chinhae, South Korea

  • Tracked over 400 personnel records, ensuring timely evaluation and recognition of achievements.
  • Maintained all regulations, documentation, and correspondence; and administered the Command budget of more than $7 million.
  • Planned over 100 Distinguished Visitor itineraries for travel to the Chinhae area, including the Secretary of Defense, Secretary of the Navy, Chief of Naval Operations, and Commanders, U.S. Forces Korea and 7th Fleet.
  • Served as interim Base Commander on numerous occasions when the Commanding Officer was not available.
  • Initiated a monthly meeting with U.S. and Korean Naval officers for integrated planning opportunities.
  • Developed and participated in 8 one-week-long English immersion classes for Korean sailors. Earned an award from the Chief of Naval Operations, Republic of Korea, for the Command’s role in this effort.
  • Extra duties: Installation Webmaster, Public Affairs Officer, Training Officer, Protocol Officer, Senior Watch Officer, and served for 2 months as acting Executive Officer.
Navy Commendation Medal

text.headline: Operational Training & Readiness Officer (N7)
text.text:
NAVAL FORCES KOREA, Seoul, South Korea

(Concurrently with Fleet Activities Chinhae duties – see timeline below)

  • Served on the global board of Regional Training Directors, formulating Navy training and readiness policy and strategy for all U.S. Navy sailors stationed in Korea. Personally prepared training curriculums for over 600 U.S. Navy active duty sailors and 14,000+ reserve support personnel serving in Korea.
  • Wrote the long-range (10+ years) Regional Training Instruction in accordance with the new training requirements published by Navy Installations Command.

text.headline: Operations Officer
text.text:
FLEET ACTIVITIES CHINHAE, Chinhae, South Korea

  • Planned operational exercises and responses to various wartime scenarios, and led the Command response in 8 Tier I Joint / Combined Exercises, ensuring effective mission capability for the U.S. Navy in South Korea.
  • Requested funding ($8M+), helped design, and oversaw set-up of a new Regional Maritime Operations Center.
  • Designed and maintained the commands public facing website.
Navy Commendation Medal

text.headline: Public Affairs Officer
text.text:
U.S. NAVAL SHIP REPAIR FACILITY / JAPAN REGIONAL MAINTENANCE CENTER, Yokosuka, Japan

  • United a multi-national team and developed an 88-item checklist based upon 14 regulations that the U.S. Government, Department of Defense, and U.S. Navy issued regarding publicly accessible websites.
  • Re-coded the Command website to ensure 100% compliance with all applicable regulations.
  • Created and published a weekly news story for the local newspaper highlighting different comman departments or events.
  • Scripted, filmed, produced and edited a weekly news story for the local TV station.
Navy Achievement Medal

text.headline: First Lieutenant
text.text:
USS CURTIS WILBUR (DDG-54), Yokosuka, Japan

  • Supervised and motivated 46 sailors in their performance of seamanship functions and evolutions in a dynamic environment.
  • Prepared work schedules and directed several shipboard operations, including: mooring, docking, anchoring, fueling, towing, and transferring of personnel and cargo at sea.
  • Designed and maintained the ship's public website.

text.headline: Webmaster Assistant and Information Technology Support
text.text:
U.S. NAVAL ACADEMY, Annapolis, MD

  • Led the merger of over 280 web servers into a single combined system in order to bring the U.S. Naval Academy web presence into alignment with Department of Defense information security and visual design policies.
  • Developed and managed a database system using MySQL to track midshipman attendance at all summer training activities.
  • Designed and maintained both the internal and external websites for all summer training events. This allowed midshipman parents and relatives to securely follow training events throughout the summer, and also allowed U.S. Naval Academy personnel to easily submit pictures or other information about the incoming class members.

text.headline: Regimental Midshipman Information Systems Liasion Officer (MISLO)
text.text:
U.S. NAVAL ACADEMY, Annapolis, MD

  • Responsible for all Information Technology related issues for over 850 midshipmen.
  • Designed and maintained the Regiment website.
  • Provided 2nd tier IT support to all Regiment midshipmen.
  • Managed 5 Company-level MISLOs in the performance of their duties.
  • Primary editor for Brigade level website due to web development expertise.

text.headline: Company Midshipman Information Systems Liasion Officer (MISLO)
text.text:
U.S. NAVAL ACADEMY, Annapolis, MD

  • Responsible for all Information Technology related issues for over 140 midshipmen.
  • Designed and maintained the Company website.
  • Provided 3nd tier IT support to all Company midshipmen.

text.headline: Assistant Workcenter Supervisor
text.text:
USS NIMITZ (CVN-68)

  • Managed 68 Sailors in the performance of their duties. Responsible for ensuring that all maintenance tasks in the ship's nuclear powered engine room were completed according to procedures. Ran the engine room’s Quality Assurance program.
  • Placed in charge of the ship's Main Reduction Gears (valued in excess of $50M).
  • Nominated and recommended for acceptance to the U.S. Naval Academy by the ship's Commanding Officer.
  • Secret Clearance.

text.headline: Woodland Firefighter / Timberworker
text.text:
GREYBACK FORESTRY, INC., Merlin, OR

  • Spent the summer after high school working in the Oregon forests, conducting fuel-reduction work in order to prevent out of control wildfires.
  • Trained as a firefighter with one of the best private forest fire fighting teams in the world.

(NOTE: There were no forest fires on the west coast in the summer of 1997.)

text.headline: Student Intern
text.text:
BUREAU OF LAND MANAGEMENT (BLM), Medford, OR

First high school student selected by the BLM as part of a work / study program. My daily schedule alternated between high school and field work with the BLM.

  • Designed a custom-made gate using AutoCAD for a bat hibernation cave.
  • Conducted wide area population surveys for the endangered Spotted Owl.
  • Performed logging work area inspections to verify that timber companies only cut approved trees.

text.headline: Sales Associate
text.text:
OFFICE MAX, Medford, OR

  • Youngest associate assigned to the Electronics section, due to my aptitude with computers.
  • Led the store for Electronics Department sales.

text.headline: Expediter
text.text:
BEAVER LECTRONICS, White City, OR

Beaver Lectronics was a small contract manufacturing company specializing in Printed Circuit Board (PCB) and wiring harness manufacturer.

  • Responsible for the timely delivery of materials throughout the 5-warehouse manufacturing complex.
  • Worked as a " pick-n-place" machine operator placing components on PCBs when all material routing was complete.
